Content: Dim Forest Ecological Survey (1)

The Dim Forest is, no doubt, the greatest treasure trove in Huanglong, and there is no region that compares to it in terms of species abundance.
Just standing at the entrance of this gate, I could clearly hear the voices of the plants and hear their call.
Even more fortunately, such precious plant data is so close in reach! What the chimpanzee was holding in his hand was exactly what the plantain plant named XXX looked like in the image documents. It was recorded that this fruit, popular among both young and old, had been widely cultivated before the Lament.
However, as a triploid plant, XXX, like most cash crop plants that require breeding techniques, disappeared after the Lament. Information about this fragile species can now be found in some historical literature.
Although regretable this is also the natural law of succession. According to Verina's law, stagnation is one of the most important factors of biological extinction, and this is the inevitable end of XXX in the wild, which has been artificially deprived of its ability to reproduce.
Dim Forest Ecological Survey (2)

Guided by the XXX and the sounds of the plant, I came to this stunningly beautiful large tree with purple branches and leaves.
Judging from the shape of the leaves, it is possible that this plant is a subspecies of Ficus arborvitae. However, the origin of the wonderful purple color on the leaves is unknown, and further research is needed to verify it.
The large tree is perennially cooped up with parenting female orangutans underneath, which makes them sensitive and rabid. To avoid a head-on confrontation, I plucked a large amount of gorilla hair through days of collecting and making it a coat. By such means, I took and effort to get close enough to the big tree and collected samples of some of the leaves.
However, because of the season, no samples of the flowers as well as the fruits of the species were collected, and no pollinating insects were seen in the vicinity. There are still many mysteries to be revealed.
But I am sure that this is the first time this species is discovered. I tentatively named it XXX and made an appointment with it to come back sometime to hear its story of more than a century.
Goodbye, XXX and I'll see you again when the season is right.
Dim Forest Ecological Survey (3)

After bidding farewell to the Xxx, I headed towards the most important goal, the Confinement Woods.
It was a tree that was visually over 200m high, and anyone could smell the aura of great adventure emanating from this giant tree. Its presence seemed to indicate the infinite power of life, and I and Xxx were attracted by its vitality like then afternoon sun. We were involuntarily leaping and cheering.
But the closer we get to the tree, the more anxious the plants sound. Even the duckweed beneath the feet are making strange noises.
I rarely find this phenomenon outside the radiation range of Tacet Fields. Finding the source of this phenomenon may be lead to the reason why the trees throughout the Dim Forest, both the Confinement Woods and the Xxx just now are so huge.
So what am I waiting for? It's better to get up and go now than to sit and talk!
Dim Forest Ecological Survey (4)

Whew, I don't know when the last time was when I had such a strenuous movement.
The shell of the car I stepped on when I jumped down was surprisingly hiding a TD of XXX. It was the first time I saw such a persistent TD, which started to chase as if really enraged. It chased me from the Confinement Woods all the way here before I could get rid of it.

But this is already near the Tacet Field, with soil barren and the plants left with only sounds of pain. There is nothing I can do for plants in this state. I have to cheer up! Decay and extinction are also part of ecology. Nature is not always gentle, and it is my duty to detect and witness it.
Dim Forest Ecological Survey (5)

The environment of the Confinement Woods is even more magical than expected. A unique canopy ecosystem has formed around the branches of this giant tree.
According to my investigation, the tree's branches contain abundant Resonance Energy within. The energy gathered from around the area of the Dim Forest travels from the top of the tree to the entire trunk. Under the catalyst of this energy, such a huge tree was formed. And it is by relying on these energies that the tree reproduces a whole different ecosystem. Probably because of the ferocious roars that come from time to time within the tree, the tree has no signs of activity from large MO or TD. This gives the plants a better chance to flourish and allows the Remnant Mutterfly to exist.
The skills of the Resonator who created this giant tree is very similar to mine. I guess he is also a nature lover. Otherwise, even with the assistance of the sonic instrument at the top of the tree, it is unlikely that such a large and complex giant tree could have been created.
In order to facilitate future expeditions, I made a little fluorescent decoration on the branch of Confinement Woods as a sign. This will make future research expeditions more efficient. So it's time to go, to explore the depths of the Confinement Woods!
Dim Forest Ecological Survey (Conclusion)

Jueyuan: However, most species in the region are in a relatively precarious situation. Take the XXX in the conservation area for example, the species is essentially on the verge of functional extinction and needs timely artificial conservation.

Recorder: Huaijin

The Academy and the Ministry jointly released the latest version of the "Wutheron Leakage Emergency Response Manual", and the foreman said that I knew best about Tacetite energy here, so I should study it first and give the other mine workers some trainings in a couple of days. More than sixty pages of instructions in two days. It should be two weeks at least.
"For personnel, equipment and materials contaminated with radioactive dust, the damage can be reduced by cleaning and decontamination."
 "Contaminated wastewater must be treated by ion exchange and must not be discharged at will."
The people at the Academy must be fools. If this is a manual for miners, they should use simple and straightforward words. Ion exchange and blah blah, miners do not know this.
 Forget it, forget it, sure it's a trouble, but for the sake of the foreman, I will make some outlines of it.
Sigh, overtime work in the holiday. I really hope I'd get a week off after this.

Ancient Banyan "Longwang"

The ancient banyan "Longwang" is located in the northern part of Longwang land in Central Plains. According to the New Botanical Records of Huanglong, the age of Longwang is estimated to be between 1400 and 1500 years, and the tree still stands after Lament. Its roots twist and turn like a pythons and loongs; its gnarled branches resemble sharp claws, showing all the wantonness. In the early days of the Threnodian War, when faced with the TD army of the Crownless, the Huanglong Army and the villagers of Qichi worked together to resist here and achieved a valuable victory. The immovable ancient tree is like the coordinates of the earth and has become a symbol to rely on. As long as Longwang is still here, the Central Plains will be reborn again. In 147 A. L., the inhabitants of Qichi Village, with the help of Tiancheng, restored the old tree and officially named it "Longwang". Kind Reminder: Please carve marks on the trunk or branches. Everyone should be responsible for taking care of the ancient tree.
Journal without signature No. 1

Day 27
The bombing kept on for 3 hours. Then it stopped for 2 hours, and started again for another 3 hours.

Day 28
The bombing kept on for 3 hours. Then it stopped for 2 hours, and started again for another 3 hours. Sanshui tried to stop me from taking note of this. There isn't a routine. But I count the time by watching Gui sigh. He sighs every half an hour. I know his habit, it's always like that.
It's necessary to note the time. There will be the day we get out of here.
Journal without signature No. 2

Day 109
Today there were two loud noises, I couldn't tell what they were. There was a pause in the middle of about two minutes or...... three minutes? When the first noise came, the new bed Gui just built was shaken all apart, sand and dust from the stone cracks overhead clattering off. he was immediately shocked, frozen there. And when the second noise striked, he howled violently all of a sudden.
Sanshui told him to shut up, but he kept howling. Sanshui gave him a slap, told him to not affect others.
I didn't care, though. At the first noise, I was already thinking about my next life. In my next life I want to be a Gulpuff, and I'll prick whoever messes with me, so I don't have to hide in this dull cave.

Day 110
Sanshui said Threnodians could trample hundres of Gulpuffs into pieces in one blow. I said that wouldn't matter. The Gulpuffs would prick his foot.
No sounds heard today.
Journal without signature No. 3

Gui's baby was born at night. The moonlight shone in through the big hole that was blown open, and it was quite bright. Everyone was yakking and trying to name the child, and we finally chose "Changming". The child immediately cried, and then Gui followed, and everyone cried, even Sanshui also wiped his eyes.
Before the roof of the cave was blown open, daylight could not be seen at this place. When we listen to the artillery fire outside, in addition to fear, there was also a little unspeakable...... ease. Now well, people always know the dawn and dusk, the rain and shine. Everyone has decided to live here. I give up on thinking about how the Threnodians will end up. We are good here.

Maybe, in the future, someone will come here for investigation and find "cavemen" or something like that. I'm writing this down because I hope the explorer won't treat us like ancient apes, and make it awkward with all the verifications and research.
We are just villagers who came here for refuge, nothing special, no need to remember us.

*Special Afterward* Our Last Farewell
We have been with you for two years and two months without noticing, and our magazine has successfully reached its 100th issue. At the end of this monumental issue, we would like to say goodbye to all of you.
The Lament and the Threnodian War have completely changed the Central Plains, and various sudden disasters have made it difficult for us to resist. At this rate, the Hotel of Comfort will not be able to live up to its name and give travelers a truly safe and comfortable living experience.
But our farewell will not be as sudden as Lament. We will continue to operate for another month, and after the transfer, the building will be preserved and taken over by Tiancheng. As for what will become of it, please stay in the loop!
Philosophy Notebook - Windwatch Lighthouse Memo

...There are many rumors about it, not only from the outside world, but also from within the Pioneer Association.
Since my interest was piqued, I have read almost all the materials left by the predecessors, and have also consulted with those who took on the investigation mission, but no conclusions were drawn. Therefore, all I can do it to leave my thoughts here.

"Above the Windwatch Lighthouse are the stars that ignite the universe."
"It's rare to see such a vibrant antiquity. It's the light of civilization, as the poets say."
"This land is full of scars, yet it never gives up on self-healing. The light that shines every night is a manifestation of its healing. Breathe in, breathe out, breathe in... If one day the light no longer shines, perhaps..."
"Lighthouse, lighthouse! What on earth does it illuminate? A bright hope, or an unknown mystery that leads to darkness?"

Component Analysis for Mists in Hazy Depths

Author: Yanshu
Since the beginning of the "TD Wave" (Years 130-155 ), the fog in the Hazy Depths located at the bottom of the Hukou, the Tiger's Maw, has increased dramatically, and the Academy has detected a large number of Wutheron activity signals at this location.
The purpose of this exploration is to continue to investigate the fog, and to rescue the people trapped inside. Members are as follows:
Special Operations Company, Vanguard Battalion, Huanglong Midnight Rangers Regiment (111162)
Geological Exploration Team, Huaglong Academy
......
Analysis of Results Regarding the Investigation of the Unknown Fog:
This exploration collected samples of the mists in the tunnel connecting the Hukou Mine and the Hazy Depths, and analyzed them in the field using the [Simple Spectrometer] carried by the team. Based on the results of this test, we speculate that the mist appears to be a biological component, with a composition similar to the scale powder on the wings of lepidopteran insects, showing non-toxic, low-temperature properties.
We infer that the danger of the mists come from its low temperature:
①	Condensation of water vapor due to low temperatures can greatly impede vision and cause investigators to lose judgment of direction in the foggy area.
②	Low temperatures can directly affect the health status of investigators, prolonged hypothermia leads to reduced physical vitality and the inability to respond to hazards in a timely manner.
However, our current investigation has not yet identified the anomalous sound coming from within the fogs proper, and considering that the unknown sound may lead to panic among the people nearby and affect the operations of the mine, it is recommended that the above information be withheld from the public.

All staff is advised to avoid mists and suspend mining works around the Hazy Depths.

What is that... what have we gone through... where are we now?
Them, my companions taken by the mists. Where are them?
...

Battle Log No. 6010: Entering Autumn

It's the fifth day of deployment in the battlefield, and I have finally time to jot down something.
I was arranged clerk for the XXX. For the whole the 30 people in the XXX, I have to record everything from their food, their hydration, to their rest, their possession, all while the Geiger Counters beep all day and shells drop near us now and then.
I don't know if fortune favors me or it doesn't, because a bomb hit the shelter I dug and burnt my pack down to ashes, while I was out transmitting the order and spared of it. Nevertheless, the absense of sleeping bags and clothes for change in late Autumn became a worry, leaving me in frustration of how I would make it through the winter.
The deputy in charge of logistics was a warmhearted man, who offered me his new sleeping bag and clothes, and went to use mildewed spare supply himself. I only took the bag and promised to return it to him when we are resupplied. He said nothing, neither took back the clothers; instead he smiled, and then left. I didn't care to chase because of the cold in the night. Could give things back tomorrow.
Battle Log No. 6010: Battle for Point 91.7

11 nights witnessed the battle for the 91.7 highland. Our XXX lost 16 men, including our deputy. 7 serious injuries and 8 mild injuries. The battle progressed as follows:
In late November, the enemy assaulted our 9.17 highland, which was not named. For days of nights of fighting and contending, most of the surface of the highland was occupied by the enemy. On October 27, we received the command to go in to battle and back up friendly forces.
Under fire cover, our force launched 6 strikes on the enemy with 8 hours, all of which failed to drived the enemy away from the highland.
Early 28 morning, the enemy launched an unresultful counter-strike with covers of cannon firing.
From Octboer 28 until Nov 6, the control ot the highland was transferred back and forth a few times, but there weren't decisive results for both sides.
Night Nov 6, my force was replaced by a friendly one which would take on our duties due to the severe headcount loss of more than 70%.
Summary of Battle:
The loss of my force was predominantly done by close-range fire. This, for one, proves the defense insights about indirect fire circulated within the army; for another, it makes the case for the underpreparation of my force with respect to close-range crossfire. Detailed battle review is attached hereafter.
Battle Log No. 6010: Reorganize

It is November 8 today. We retreated to our rear for rearmament as per the order. The rumbling of cannons keeps coming through from 91.7. No doubt that highland is to be the key to the whole battle. The side that takes it takes control.
On that highland, which hardly covers some ground, flesh and blood have become the strongest defense lines. All the steels knee before them.
I am glad I didn't borrow the deputy's new clothes, for at least he can be taken home with pride.
He told me a tale, which he said was told by his grandfather, that when one passes, his homecoming soul will be hitched with breezes to where he belongs. Now it's late night, I wonder if my comrades are on their way to return.
Battle Log No. 6010: Departure again

On Nov 15, we met the backup we waited for: two recruits. Together with the 12 men left, we formed a squad. Since we kept the establishment of XXX, my title of acting deputy squad leader was nominally acting deputy XXX leader.
The battle at 91.7 drained our reserves. It's time the undermanned forces, that is us, be sent back to the front. We are infiltrating into enemies' rear. As soon as the encircle is done, we will be positioned to annihilate the enemy.
The enemy has realized this. They are planning a desperate sally intended to break our front and encircle our flanks in turn. The fate of this decisive battle is soon to be seen.
Battle Log No. 6010: This may be my last

Female Voice: "47 days, in which I became an acting leader from a common recruit."
Female Voice: "Enemies flooded towards us like cockroaches without stop."
Female Voice: "And we didn't hesitate to squash them, like always."
[pause for a while, deep breath]
Female Voice: "Mum, I'll be back. They will take me back. Just don't lock the window."
Incineranur Security Administration

1. No trespassing for unauthorized personnel in Incineranur. Vialotors at their own risk. Authorized personnel should abide by the code of conduct.

2. Operations within the area of Incineranur should be authorized and done with proper certifications.

3. Protective Equipment should be carefully used before entrance into Incineranur. Resonator should simultaneously hold and wear insulators and wave absorbers; non-Resonators should refrain from entering unless necessary. Wear additional, correct protection in extraordinary cases.

4. Operation in the area of Incineranur should not exceed 3 hours. In the cases of any physical of mental discomfort during operation, leave immediately and seek medical inspection.

5. Personnel involved in long-term operations in the area should receive regular mental assessments to avoid potential sanity detoriation.
Footnotes of Time - 91

That little girl, Annalica, said there might be "pocket piano" here. We should have arrived at what her coordinate indicates.
But we found only dolls blown to pieces, model cars that don't run after a hard searching effort. We are not even seeing a trace of piano.
Though that kid can always find bizarre gadgets in plies of antiquities, I doubt the existence of this "pocket piano".
Footnotes of Time - 92

It is wet lately. There might be reverse rain, so I found a weapon remains for cover.
I met a pair of brother and sister there resting. Two small kids, on their alert to strangers. Looked like home runaways.
I was going to call Morn Guards from the camp to take them back, but they jumped over to me, and almost bumped into my brim.
"Pleasem uncle, don't send to take us. My sister and I just wanted to go and see the flower fields." The boy with a larger size looked at me sincerely, getting me in a dilemma.
I gave in at the end. Who's not curious when he's young? I hadn't found much at that time, so why not help them a little. I'd just take it as a trial of luck at the Incineranur.
Footnotes of Time - 93

We stopped at the edge of the Incineranur and the two kids nodded to each other as if to confirm something. Then the boy took out a small, delicate box from his backpack and hesitated for just a moment before casting the contents of the box into Incineranur.
Soon, the long apparatus melted into nothing in the burning heat, and when I turned my head, the two kids were wailing.
Sigh, I traveled all over the world fearing hardly anything, only children crying. Good thing I took the blown doll in my treasure box. I took it out and soothed the kids from crying.
Although this old toy did not get into the tower, it didn't go wasted.
Footnotes of Time - 94

On the way of sending the children back, Annalica sent a very low-resolution picture through, said it was the photo of the "pocket piano" she took much effort to find.
Surprisingly,...... it was the thing that was just thrown into the Incineranur, a historical treasure! Turned into ashes right before my eyes!
"That is grandfather and grandmother's love token." The little girl said.
"Indeed! Grandpa said that during the war, he and grandma were scattered by the crowd and the place where they separated was just the location of the flower sea. He also said......" said the boy, about to cry again, "he said that if one day he too left, we should put the pocket piano in the flower sea so he could play for grandma again."
"But...... but I heard dad say something about this thing selling for a good price, just today! He was going to sell it, sob..."
How can the value of antiques be measured in terms of money? In that case, I have to thank the two little kids for allowing me to witness the instantaneous glow of antiques blooming in this era.
Footnotes of Time - 95

After reading my metric records, Annalica exclaimed that it was a waste.
Perhaps in her opinion, the only way to realize the true value of an ancient object is to incorporate it into the Abyssturrim.
If possible, I really hope that this little girl can step out of Abyssturrim and make sense of the real world. She will become part of the footnotes of history, together with all the metrologists.

Sea Eroded Ruins Ecological Investigation

Before I came to Huanglong, I had heard about the magical "mushrooms" growing here.
They are huge red corals thriving in the concrete jungle. They reproduce at an incredible rate and possess a potent hallucinogenic ability. They are the true rulers of these city ruins. When the sea receded, the people of Huanglong thought they could reclaim their homeland, only to face attacks by these evolved corals - a hallucinatory phenomenon known as the "Mirage".
No one knows what the first investigators saw, the past or the future? Those who barely escaped lost interest in everything, and soon passed away due to hunger strike. Therefore, reconstruction here was halted.
However, one day, the scarlet color faded, and the scarlet psilocybin content in the spores they emitted sharply declined, as if their growth period had ended suddenly. But will they continue to evolve? Will new dangers emerge?
Apart from exiles who don't value their lives, no one is willing to settle in these ruins full of unknowns.

Reconstruction History of Huanglong

In 110A. L.  The magical Suiguang defeated the Threnodians. A young girl named Xin Yi used a little fire to rebuild the hope in people's hearts. She delivered an inspiring speech at a temporary shelter and the fervor to rebuild Huanglong rose up everywhere. Xin Yi led the first step of reconstruction around Chengxiao Mountain, the sleeping place of the magical being.

In 115 A. L., the new capital was decided with the help of Choral Calculus Center, which is now the site of Tiancheng.

In 116 A. L., construction of the new capital, Tiancheng, began on the first day of the New Year.

In 120 A. L., the first phase of construction was completed and most of the inhabitants moved to the city from around the region, and in the following decades, the infrastructure of the city continue to improve.

In 134 A. L., Tiancheng was attacked for the first time by a TD wave. Since then, the TD waves have been frequent and remain to this day one of the greatest dangers threatening Huanglong.

In 155 A. L., tTo inspire the people, a ceremony was held to honor the Four Great Masters of Huanglong. In the same year, Jinxi, who resonated with the magical Suiguang, became the new Dragon Master.

In 157 A. L., Huanglong was attacked by the largest ever offensive of TD since its reconstruction. It was  known as the Great TD wave, which cost a heavy toll. The reconstructed Tiancheng was only protected after Jinxi awakened Suiguang.

Today, Huanglong is recovering from the trauma, and Tiancheng has become a place of hope for all Huanglong people.

Minutes of Mourn Guard Commander's Murder

Date: 159 A. L.
Confidentiality: S
Minutes of Case: 
In 159 A. L., the former head of Mourn Guards, Xuguan, was assassinated outside the central command hall and died despite rescue.
After investigation, there were obvious signs of struggles at the scene, and several people witnessed fire that night, accompanied by the sound of an explosion. It is induced that, according to remaining data, the suspect(s) could be Resonators with skills.
When Mourn Guard patrol team arrived, the suspect(s) had disappeared, not found desptie a lockdown of all city entrances. It is presumed that the suspect(s) has or have a different means of movement than normal people.
The red fragment was left in the hands of the head of the Syukan, which is suspected to be a clue, wass too small to help lock the target for the time being.
The matter is of great importance, so it is recommended that the details of the case not be made public for the time being and that the investigation be conducetd in secret.

A Journal

Ma Xiu: Mr. Painter, what is this painting?
Painter: A parting gift to you, a scene of your passing, Mr. You.
Ma Xiu: Ha ha ha ha! You are a strange man for such an unusual parting gift.
Painter: I thought you would be a little angry.
Ma Xiu: I've got a wonderful temper since I had my daughter.
Painter: Speaking of your daughter, she seems to be a weak person.
Ma Xiu: What makes you think so? She has always been a brave child.
Painter: She didn't like the name "Ma Xiaofang".
Ma Xiu: What do you make of that?
Painter: It feels like she doesn't even have the courage to face herself.
Ma Xiu: It's not easy to face oneself. I know my child, and she will be the bravest hero.
Painter: What if she had the chance to save you, but she should miss that moment because of her weak nature.
Ma Xiu:......
Ma Xiu: Mr. Painter, are you serious?
Painter: Can't be more.
Ma Xiu: Mr. Painter, it is an honor for me to see your amazing skill in telling fortunes. But I think you are wrong on this point.
Painter: About your passing?
Ma Xiu: No, about my child.
Ma Xiu: If there would be a moment like that, as you said, then my departure must be the beginning of her heroic path.
Painter: Why?
Ma Xiu: I have already said why.
Painter: Hmm?
Ma Xiu: I know my child, and one day she will be the bravest hero.
Painter: Mr. Xiu, you are also a strange man....... Then let's wait and see.
Three Verse of Back to Dream · Tear of Stone Vane

Third Verse of Dream Lingering · Tears of Stone Leaves

Intro:
The farewell at Xingchui is years behind. From you on foreign soils I hear no sign.
Who cries in the chilling wind every night? Stone leaves are proof of love ever cross time.
Hear me, my audience. When the Threnodian war was right settled, a couple grew up together in Qichi Village at the bank of Xingchui River in Central Plains. The boy, named Branch, aged fifteen, was a gallant warrior and an adept swimmer. Unafraid of the Tacet Discords, he led a major victory by commanding a nightly charge against the enemy across the Xingchui River. A young hero he was. The girl, named leaf, aged thirteen, had sharp knowledgement and clear undestanding of the bigger picture. Every decision she made could always lift people out of crises. The two were intimate and helped each other a lot.
At that time, there was an ancient tree, with luxuriant branches, standing in central Plains. Huanglong had won a great victory under the shadow thereof, so people thought that was an auspicious place, and wanted to rebuild a new home here, in order to get blessings. When the war stopped, the two should have been free, but instead they took on this matter. Leaf said: "Although the war is gone, but the hearts of the people are still concerned. If the ancient wood can give solace, it may be a good cause. I decide to go with them and for help." Soon she farewelled Branch. The two since lived in two places, each helping rebuild a village. The good part is that their correspondence carried on and their relationship sustained. A poem described them:
The sky's high, leaves reaching it; the land's far, roots connect it.
Leaf and his party arrived at the outskirts of the ancient tree, and then proceeded to perform civil engineering. The villagers wanted to get the blessing of the tree, so they named the village after name of the tree, Devno, meaning to develop novol lands, and to say goodbye to the old. One day, a villager suddenly found a strange leaf. The leaf was so new with no signs of drying, but white and green patterns intertwined. The villagers were happy: "It must be a response from Devno, a sign of rewarding us. Let me now find a small table, presented at home, so I can always feel the blessing of Devno." The rest of the villagers, if they found this leaf, also followed suit. A poem had it:
Leaves grow with green and white; hearts filled with anxiety and yearning.
May the omen be always there; and bless them with lasting fortune.
A few days later, a strange disease broke out in the village. The patients would suffer at night, with their body feeling strange pain, as if heavy hammers were beating them, or swords cutting their flesh. Even stranger, they would say they hear sad cries, like yells or howls, incessantly. The sick would be caught in depression, weakness within five days of falling sick. The people then said: "At that time, we built the village neighboring the great tree in the wish that Devno would bless us, and its branches and leaves extend our lives. Today, my life is not long, so it must be Devno's notification to us; My hearing of lamentation at night must be the great tree's cry for help!" The villagers all thought that was true.They looked in retrospect and found themselves cut many trees when the village was built, which might bring karma to them. Therefore they prohibited cutting trees again.

A Restored Notice

Welcome to Wetland Nature Park! Our park is situated around a stunning wetland, which serves as an important stopover and habitat for migratory birds. Each year, tens of thousands of migratory birds spend their winters here, making it a prime location for bird watching. The best time to watch these magnificent birds is from October to March of the following year.
Two of these particular birds are local star species, also known collectively as feathered herons. They are large wading birds with a docile disposition. Not only do they live in harmony with their family members but they are also willing to get close to humans and always maintain a precious sense of trust towards humans.
Therefore, we kindly request that all visitors refrain from feeding the feathered herons. If you wish to contribute to the protection of the feathered heron population, please contact the rescue station.
